statusDetails.trace:
driver = <appium.webdriver.webdriver.WebDriver (session="888ad307f6ac5fc2c6d9c8f3fb84da1fc0421c13")>

    def test_sorting_by_price(driver):
        login(driver)
        pp = ProductsPage(driver)
        pp.wait_for_products()
    
        # 1) open sort control
        opened, errors = _open_sort_control(driver)
        if not opened:
            pytest.skip(f"Sort button not found on this build. Attempts: {errors}")
    
        # 2) collect candidate options from the opened modal
        candidates = _collect_sort_option_candidates(driver)
        if not candidates:
            # nothing obvious found — try a broad set of clickable items as fallback
            try:
                fallback = driver.find_elements(AppiumBy.XPATH, "//XCUIElementTypeCell|//XCUIElementTypeOther|//XCUIElementTypeButton")
                candidates = []
                for e in fallback[:8]:
                    try:
                        txt = (e.text or e.get_attribute("label") or e.get_attribute("name") or "").strip()
                    except Exception:
                        txt = ""
                    candidates.append((e, txt or "<no-text>"))
            except Exception:
                candidates = []
    
        print(f"[DEBUG] Sort option candidates discovered: {[t for (_, t) in candidates]}")
    
        if not candidates:
            pytest.skip("Could not enumerate sort options on this build")
    
        # 3) Try each candidate option until prices become ascending
        tried = []
        success = False
        last_prices = []
        for idx, (elem, text) in enumerate(candidates):
            tried.append(text)
            # click the option element
            try:
                try:
                    elem.click()
                except Exception:
                    try:
                        driver.execute_script("mobile: tap", {"element": elem.id})
                    except Exception:
                        loc = elem.location
                        size = elem.size
                        driver.execute_script("mobile: tap", {"x": int(loc['x'] + size['width'] / 2), "y": int(loc['y'] + size['height'] / 2)})
            except Exception as e:
                # if click fails, continue to next candidate (but attempt to re-open the modal)
                print(f"[DEBUG] click candidate '{text}' failed: {e}")
                # try to re-open modal for next candidate
                opened, _ = _open_sort_control(driver)
                time.sleep(0.6)
                continue
    
            # allow UI to change
            time.sleep(1.2)
    
            # collect prices and check
            prices = _collect_prices_after_sort(driver)
            last_prices = prices[:]
            print(f"[DEBUG] After selecting option '{text}' prices: {prices}")
    
            if prices and prices == sorted(prices):
                success = True
                print(f"[DEBUG] Option '{text}' produced sorted ascending prices.")
                break
    
            # if not sorted, re-open sort modal to try next option
            try:
                opened, _ = _open_sort_control(driver)
                time.sleep(0.6)
            except Exception:
                pass
    
        if not success:
            # helpful debug output
            src_snip = (driver.page_source or "")[:3000]
>           pytest.fail(
                "No sort option produced ascending prices.\n"
                f"Tried options: {tried}\n"
                f"Last prices observed: {last_prices}\n"
                "Page-source start:\n" + src_snip
            )
